meanings.definition: To move faster than someone or something by crawling.
meanings.sent1: The determined toddler managed to outcrawl his older sister in the race.
meanings.sent2: The baby outcrawled the snail on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The race was intense as the babies tried to outcrawl each other to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The spider outcrawled the ant, reaching the top of the wall first.
meanings.sent5: The athlete trained hard to outcrawl all competitors in the crawling competition.

meanings.sent1: The energetic puppy would always outcrawl the other dogs in the park.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar outcrawled its siblings to reach the juicy leaves first.
meanings.sent3: The snail challenged the turtle to a race to see who could outcrawl the other.
meanings.sent4: The determined baby outcrawled the obstacles in its path to reach the toy.
meanings.sent5: The spider's ability to outcrawl its prey made it a successful hunter.
